comments.text:
+aj19bcx No, that general rule was there in order to prevent corporations 
from forcing their employees to work continuous consecutive days in a row 
without days off. Imagine a job where workers could be forced to work 30+ 
days in a row with no days off! And in most Red States where they have 
"Right to Work" laws that allow corporations to exploit salary loopholes by 
forcing their employees to put in extreme hours without overtime pay. With 
the at least one day off every seven days, there is established by law a 
reason for work week scheduling that would otherwise not exist. That is so 
corporations cannot work their staff without suitable compensation. In 
"Right to Work" Red States, (Red being Republican), employees are no longer 
protected by such laws. Overtime no longer effectively exists thanks to 
such loopholes. Sounds like something we used to have in this country about 
a century and a half ago. Do you know what that was?

it isn't them being the slave.

top_comment.text:
I love Cenk and I love TYT, but I do have to acknowledge that Cenk is 
blinded by Obama hate and it makes him do things like lie to his audience. 
Cenk is smart enough to know these things:

(1) Obama has been pivotal at protecting programs that are essential to the 
survival of the middle class, specifically Social Security, Medicare, 
Medicaid, unemployment insurance, food stamps, and child welfare programs. 
If McCain had been elected in 2008, all of those programs would have been 
eliminated or gutted.

(2) Obamacare has extended heath care to 11 million and counting, and 
extended Medicaid to many millions more. Obamacare has also strengthened 
and improved healthcare for all the people who already had health insurance 
with new regulations that protect the public.

(3) Any failure on Obama's part to do more is directly attributable to the 
fact that the Republicans made a conscious, deliberate decision on DAY ONE 
of Obama's presidency that they would obstruct *everything* he tried to do 
as president, and would prevent any economic recovery that would boost 
Obama's popularity, make a 2nd Obama term more likely, or contribute to his 
post-presidential legacy. To put it bluntly, Republicans declared war on 
the president and the American people since 2008.

Now, don't get me wrong. I know there are a lot of truly ignorant people in 
this world. I am constantly running into people who don't know any of the 
above. But Cenk isn't one of those people. Cenk is very aware that no 
matter what Obama wanted to do, he would be blocked by Republicans and 
their control of the US House of Representatives.

So how come Cenk constantly ignores this fact in his bashing of the 
president? How come he pretends, day after day, that Obama could accomplish 
*anything* on the legislative front than he has?

I honestly don't know. I can't think of any good reason why Cenk would lie 
like this to his audience. If I had to guess I would say he does it because 
he wants to expand his audience to include as many Obama-haters as he can. 
Maybe he figures that's his most promising business plan. If that's the 
case, it's cynical and dishonest, but at least it makes sense in an 
immoral, mercenary kind of way.﻿

comments.author: HeCezTheTruth

comments.text:
1.  The only reason why Social Security has survived the chopping block is 
because of gridlock.  The Democrats were all too willing to sacrifice it on 
the altar of the big red elephant, bending over backwards to appease them.  
But it wasn't enough of a concession for the GOP, so they blocked it.

2.  You oversell it.  While a marginal improvement, the ACA is a giant 
giveaway to big insurance, a bill riddled with loopholes ready and waiting 
to be exploited.  There's very little measure if any to control the costs 
of drugs and services rendered, no punishments for the insurance companies 
that are directly responsible for the deaths of too many to count.  The 
biggest mistake Obama made was ultimately leaving insurance companies in 
charge, and picking Liz Fowler, former CEO of Wellpoint, to be in charge of 
its implementation.

3.  You assume that Obama even had any intention of doing these things to 
begin with.  That he folds to the slightest pressure and criticism from the 
right is not only highly telling, but supremely embarrassing.  He and his 
feckless lapdogs in the democratic party are timid little puppies who can't 
sell a message or fight worth a damn for what they believe in.  And let's 
not forget what Obama can do WITHOUT Congress, like free the 80+ Gitmo 
inmates who have been cleared for release.  Granting clemency to the 
journalists and whistleblowers persecuted under the overused Espionage Act, 
etc.

Or how about the things that the White House has openly fought for on its 
own, like protection of former Bush Administration officials from war crime 
prosecution, protecting the banks and giant corporations from more 
liability and regulations than under Bush, declaring the executive branch 
the power to unilaterally execute anyone abroad via drone without due 
process, judicial review, or positive ID until after the fact, then bombing 
weddings, funerals, and rescue workers.

The man is so deathly afraid of criticism from right wing politicians and 
media outlets that he gives them exactly what they want at least 85 percent 
of the time, and it's still not enough for them because they call him a 
socialist anyway.  He's not the poor little woobie you think he is.  Far 
from it.  He is a malevolent agent out to destroy and pacify the American 
left into submission to right wing policy, because that's what he really 
represents.
comments.author: MedievalWerewolf

research, teaching, library archiving and scholarship, but seeing this is a 
add, does it realy fall under fair use? edit: guess it falls under 
criticism maybe?
comments.author: Edolas Vermilion

comments.text:
Sorry, he can't sue. Cornin is protected by Fair Use. That's the same law 
that makes an enormous amount of what you see on TYT possible -- like all 
the news clips they show.
comments.author: Z200a

top_comment.text:
Coming from a marketing background, here's why they used cenk:

He's a liberal leaning voice who isn't white, and he criticized Obama. If 
people research cenk they'll get the false conclusion that this candidate 
is a reasonable centrist who wants to link hands across the aisle. Also, 
The republican party is trying to distance themselves, especially in texas, 
from racism (at least publicly). So in order to criticize obama they need 
token minorities to say it for them. If i were Cenk i'd be pissed lol.﻿

top_comment.author: Matthew Cameron

comments.text:
+MyEBT&me
25%?  Let's not go into hyperbole... It's likely around 8% or so, at most.  
Why?  Because Fox News is the right wing echo chamber... the place to see 
where right wing policies and positions are discussed and announced.

Of course, he's going to put them out... they ARE his ideological nemesis, 
after all... and a majority of TyT's viewing audience are the same.  If 
they're going to talk about something, it's to highlight horrible 
behavior/policy performance defined as "good work" by the right.. or simply 
hypocritical... which is what Fox News does a lot.

If you haven't watched MSNBC before, you'd get the message from TyT that 
they are an establishment media center for the Democrats that mimic Fox 
News in every respect, but for the other side of the political spectrum.  
They wouldn't be wrong on that message, either.

comments.text:
+George Ghee - Most definitely. The sequels weren't perfect movies, and 
they kind of felt like they lacked a bit of the epicness of the 1st movie 
(but that's probably because the concepts in the first one were so new and 
fresh it's difficult for anything to match the first-time "Wow" factor of 
seeing it for the first time), but they were still very good IMO. But yeah, 
if you don't know much about Existential Philosophy, or Philosophy in 
general, and don't know much about Religion other than the mainstream 
"Jesus died and rose again....so believe in him and you'll go to Heaven. 
M'kay?" dumbed-down version of Christian theology, much of the movie will 
probably go over your head. Which, honestly, is the main reason why a lot 
of people complained about it. Most Americans honestly don't know much 
about these subjects. 

A lot of the philosophy and symbolism in The Matrix series was heavily 
influenced by Mystic Christianity, Kabbalah, Sufism, Gnosticism, Buddhism, 
Platonism, atheism, Nihilism (in the Nietzschean sense) and Schopenhauer 
philosophy.
comments.author: A86

comments.text:

go back and watch those movies again.

It also helps to have a healthy grasp of existential philosophies and some 
religious theologies and symbolism....and that's probably why the 2 sequels 
had some people saying it sucked. Your average American DOESN'T know much 
about those subjects. XD
